DOC.brief_summary: The aim of the study was to to evaluate the effect of sarpogrelate, a selective serotonin receptor antagonist, and high dose statin on the reduction of coronary spasm in the patients with variant angina.
DOC.brief_title: The Effect of Sarpogrelate and High Dose Statin on the Reduction of Coronary Spasm
DOC.criteria: Clinical history of chest pain compatible with variant angina; morning chest pain aggravated by cold exposure. Angiographically proven coronary spasm; TIMI flow < 3 by spontaneous coronary spasm or intracoronary ergonovine spasm provocation test. Cardiac arrest by coronary spasm Left main coronary spasm Significant fixed coronary artery stenosis; Diameter stenosis > 70% in the major epicardial artery by coronary angiography Left ventricular ejection fraction < 30% Coagulation disorders or bleeding tendency (Platelet count < 50k, PT INR > 2.0) Significant liver disease (AST or ALT > 100 U/ml) Renal failure (SCr > 2.0 mg/dl) hypersensitivity for statin Pregnancy
